poem:
### The Silent Signal

In the digital dusk, whispers fade—  
five calls, like prayers, unanswered.  
Language of wires, misheard murmurs,  
ocean between need and notice.  

Signals drift to foreign shores,  
lost among indifferent waves.  
Voices unstitched, silence cascades,  
as the distant ears remain untroubled.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Optus admits process not followed after it missed at least five warnings of triple zero outage Optus failed to immediately respond to at least five calls from customers unable to contact triple zero in the hours before it realised its systems had failed, as the embattled telco confirmed “established processes were not followed”. The company’s chief executive, Stephen Rue said on Sunday the company had identified at least five calls, routed to an offshore customer". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Optus admits process not followed after it missed at least five warnings of triple zero outage Optus failed to immediately respond to at least five calls from customers unable to contact triple zero in the hours before it realised its systems had failed, as the embattled telco confirmed “established processes were not followed”. The company’s chief executive, Stephen Rue said on Sunday the company had identified at least five calls, routed to an offshore customer
